summary: An email from attorney Nicolas Bourtin to Sharon Cohen Levin, attaching a Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) filed by a bank regarding entities associated with Jeffrey Epstein. The bank holds approximately $30 million in accounts for these entities and seeks to close them, notifying the government in case it wishes to take action.

persons.name: Nicolas Bourtin
persons.context: Author of the email, notifying a government official about a SAR filed by a bank regarding Epstein-associated entities and the bank's intent to close accounts holding approximately $30 million.

persons.name: Sharon Cohen Levin
persons.context: Recipient of the email, being notified by an attorney about a bank's SAR and planned closure of accounts linked to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure associated with the entities named in the Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) filed by the bank.

connections.description: Attorney Bourtin is communicating with government official Levin regarding a legal/financial matter involving Epstein-associated entities.
Bourtin's email discusses a SAR filed regarding entities associated with Epstein, suggesting his law firm may be involved in representing the bank's interests related to Epstein.

events.title: SAR Filing and Bank Notification
events.description: A bank files a Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) regarding entities associated with Jeffrey Epstein and, via attorney Nicolas Bourtin, notifies the government of its intent to close the accounts of those entities, which hold approximately $30 million.

locations: New York, NY 10004-2498 (Location of Sullivan & Cromwell LLP)
keyFacts: A Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) was filed by a bank on October 1, 2019, regarding entities associated with Jeffrey Epstein.
The bank held approximately $30 million in accounts for the Epstein-associated entities named in the SAR.
The bank intended to close all accounts of the named entities and notified the government (via attorney Nicolas Bourtin) in case it wished to take action.
The communication highlights ongoing financial scrutiny and asset freezes related to Epstein following his death in August 2019.
